ground_truth: Louise slams the closet door, causing Thelma to jump. They are silent for a moment with Thelma staring down the road. She puts her finger down on the receiver as Louise hangs up the phone and walks away towards the front of the store. Thelma comes out of the front of the store, and Thelma and Louise look at each other while this sinks in. Thelma walks around to the side of the building to the phone as Louise goes into the store for a chocolate Yoohoo. Darryl is mad, but he's still watching the game. Thelma is trying not to cry and she's trying to be strong. Neither one of them say anything for a moment, and she hangs up on him. Thelma has tears running down her face and she is watching the ground as she storms back to the car. She makes a loud grunt as she slams into someone that she did not see, and both people are knocked back a few steps from the force of the collision. She notices how blue his eyes are and now she wants him to come. He starts to walk away from the car. Just then Louise comes out of the store and sees Thelma talking to this guy, and for one moment stops dead in her tracks as she takes this in, then continues toward the car. Although her face is basically expressionless, it’s possible she might kill Thelma. The Hitchhiker just nods and starts walking towards the road. The guy does seem really nice and Thelma is really frustrated that Louise wouldn't give him a ride but decides not to confront her. Louise lowers the top and backs the car out. They watch him walk away as Louise pulls out of the parking lot onto the road. They pass the Hitchhiker, who smiles and waves, and they drive down the road. There is a tight shot of the Hitchhiker as the smile fades from his face. Thelma looks sulky while Hal goes over a list of every registered green T-Bird in the state, with names scrolling by as Hal stares blankly at the screen and the name LOUISE ELIZABETH SAWYER scrolls past. They are clear of the town, and Thelma is like a dog with a bone, just won't let it drop, while Louise looks very shaken up. She keeps her eyes on the road but she's holding the steering wheel so tightly, her knuckles are white. Suddenly, she reaches over and locks her door. There is an extreme closeup of Darryl's face and J.D. is looking down the road, way off in the distance. Louise looks down the road and sees a highway patrol car coming down the road towards them, and she glides along as the cop car passes on the other side without seeing them.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Louise slams the closet door, startling Thelma. Silent, Thelma stares down the road, placing her finger on the receiver as Louise hangs up and walks to the front of the store. Emerging, they exchange looks as reality sets in. Thelma heads to the phone; Louise buys a chocolate Yoohoo. Darryl is angry but watches the game. Thelma, fighting tears, hangs up and storms back to the car, colliding with someone, observing his blue eyes, and wants him to join. Louise exits the store, sees them, momentarily freezes, then heads to the car, possibly furious with Thelma. The Hitchhiker nods and walks away. Frustrated, Thelma doesn't argue when Louise refuses to give him a ride. Louise lowers the top, backs the car out, passing the Hitchhiker, who smiles and waves, but his smile fades as they drive away. Sulky Thelma listens while Hal reviews a list of registered green T-Birds, with LOUISE ELIZABETH SAWYER scrolling by. They leave town; Thelma persists like a dog with a bone, while a shaken Louise grips the steering wheel tightly, knuckles white. She locks her door abruptly. Closeups show Darryl's face and J.D. looking down the road. Louise notices a highway patrol car coming toward them, gliding past unnoticed.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Louise slams the closet door, startling Thelma. Silent, Thelma stares down the road. She stops the call as Louise walks to the store's front. Thelma exits, and they exchange a look. While Louise buys a Yoohoo, Thelma fights tears, trying to be strong. She storms back to the car, colliding with a man whose blue eyes she notices. He starts to walk away as Louise exits and sees Thelma with him. Louise, expressionless, might be upset. The Hitchhiker nods and walks toward the road. Thelma, frustrated Louise won’t offer him a ride, doesn't confront her. Louise drives away, passing the Hitchhiker, who smiles and waves. Thelma sulks while Hal reviews registered green T-Birds, including Louise's. As they leave town, Thelma persists, but Louise, visibly shaken, focuses on the road, gripping the wheel tightly. She locks her door. Darryl's face and J.D. are seen, while Louise notices an approaching patrol car, which passes without noticing them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Louise, with a sudden burst of frustration, slams the closet door shut, causing Thelma to jump in startled surprise. For a brief moment, a heavy silence hangs in the air as Thelma fixes her gaze intently down the road. With a deliberate movement, she places her finger firmly on the receiver, just in time as Louise hangs up the phone and purposefully strides away toward the front of the store. Moments later, Thelma emerges from the front of the store, and an intense and silent exchange occurs as both Thelma and Louise lock eyes, allowing the gravity of the moment to fully sink in. Thelma then walks around to the side of the building where the phone is located, while Louise, on a mission of her own, goes into the store to grab a chocolate Yoohoo. Meanwhile, Darryl is fuming with anger, yet he remains fixated on watching the game. Thelma is battling to hold back tears, striving to maintain her composure and project strength. Neither woman utters a word for a moment, until Thelma decisively hangs up on him. Tears stream down Thelma's face as she storms back toward the car, eyes fixed on the ground. She lets out a loud, frustrated grunt when she unexpectedly collides with someone she hadn't noticed, the impact forcing both to stumble back a few steps. She is momentarily captivated by the striking blueness of his eyes, feeling a sudden desire for him to come along. As he begins to walk away from the car, Louise emerges from the store and spots Thelma in conversation with this man. For a brief instant, she freezes in place, absorbing the scene before her, then resumes her path toward the car. Although Louise's face remains essentially devoid of emotion, there is an underlying tension suggesting she might be furious with Thelma. The Hitchhiker simply nods and proceeds to walk toward the road. Despite his pleasant demeanor, Thelma is deeply frustrated that Louise refuses to give him a ride, but she ultimately chooses not to confront her about it. Louise lowers the top of the car and carefully backs out. They both watch as the Hitchhiker walks away, and as Louise maneuvers the car out of the parking lot and onto the road. They pass the Hitchhiker, who offers a friendly smile and wave, but as they continue down the road, there is a tight shot of the Hitchhiker as his smile gradually fades from his face. Thelma sits sulking while Hal methodically reviews a list of every registered green T-Bird in the entire state, names scrolling by on the screen as Hal stares blankly, with Louise Elizabeth Sawyer's name briefly appearing. Once they are clear of the town, Thelma becomes relentless like a dog with a bone, unable to let the issue drop, while Louise appears visibly shaken. Her eyes are firmly on the road, yet she grips the steering wheel so tightly that her knuckles turn white. Suddenly, she reaches over and locks her door with determination. There is an extreme closeup revealing Darryl's face, while J.D. looks down the road, focusing on something far off in the distance. Louise glances down the road and notices a highway patrol car approaching in their direction, but she seamlessly glides along as the cop car passes by on the opposite side, oblivious to their presence.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Louise, in an unexpected outburst of deep-seated frustration, forcefully slams the closet door shut with a resounding bang, causing Thelma to jump in startled shock and surprise. For a brief, tense moment, an almost tangible, heavy silence hangs thick in the air, as Thelma fixes her gaze intently and unwaveringly down the long, dusty road. With a deliberate and calculated movement, she places her finger firmly and decisively on the receiver, just in time as Louise hangs up the phone with a sense of finality and purposefully strides away toward the front of the store with determined steps. Moments later, Thelma emerges from the front of the store, and an intense, wordless exchange occurs as both Thelma and Louise lock eyes, allowing the full gravity and significance of the moment to fully sink in for both women. Thelma then briskly walks around to the side of the building where the old, weathered phone is located, while Louise, on a determined mission of her own, walks into the store to grab a chocolate Yoohoo. Meanwhile, Darryl is fuming with anger and simmering rage, yet he remains fixated on watching the game intently. Thelma is battling to hold back her tears, striving with all her might to maintain her composure and project an image of strength. Neither woman utters a single word for a moment, until Thelma decisively and resolutely hangs up on him. Tears stream down Thelma's face as she storms back toward the car, her eyes firmly fixed on the ground beneath her feet. She lets out a loud, frustrated grunt when she unexpectedly collides with someone she hadn't noticed standing in her path, the impact forcing both to stumble back a few steps in surprise. She is momentarily captivated and entranced by the striking and vivid blueness of his eyes, feeling a sudden, inexplicable desire for him to come along with them. As he begins to walk away from the car, Louise emerges from the store and spots Thelma in conversation with this man. For a brief instant, she freezes in place, taking in the scene before her with careful observation, then resumes her path toward the car. Although Louise's face remains essentially devoid of overt emotion, there is an underlying tension in her demeanor suggesting she might be furious with Thelma. The Hitchhiker simply nods and proceeds to walk toward the road with a languid stride. Despite his pleasant demeanor, Thelma is deeply frustrated and annoyed that Louise refuses to give him a ride, but she ultimately chooses not to confront her about it directly at this time. Louise lowers the top of the car with a smooth, practiced motion and carefully backs out from the parking space. They both watch as the Hitchhiker walks away, and as Louise maneuvers the car out of the crowded parking lot and onto the open road. They pass the Hitchhiker, who offers a friendly smile and wave, but as they continue driving down the road, there is a tight shot of the Hitchhiker as his smile gradually fades from his face, replaced by a more somber expression. Thelma sits sulking with visible discontent while Hal methodically reviews a list of every registered green T-Bird in the entire state, names scrolling by on the screen as Hal stares blankly, with Louise Elizabeth Sawyer's name briefly appearing amidst the list. Once they are clear of the bustling town, Thelma becomes relentless like a dog with a bone, unable to let the issue drop, while Louise appears visibly shaken and unsettled. Her eyes are firmly and unwaveringly on the road ahead, yet she grips the steering wheel so tightly that her knuckles turn white with tension. Suddenly, she reaches over and locks her door with determination and resolve. There is an extreme closeup revealing Darryl's face, filled with emotion, while J.D. looks down the road, focusing on something far off in the distance, lost in thought. Louise glances down the road and notices a highway patrol car approaching in their direction, but she seamlessly glides along with practiced ease as the cop car passes by on the opposite side, oblivious to their presence entirely.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Louise forcefully closes the closet door with a loud slam, which startles Thelma, causing her to jump slightly from surprise. They both stand in silence for a brief moment, with Thelma's gaze fixed firmly down the road, contemplating their situation. Thelma places her finger on the receiver, applying pressure to hang up the phone, while Louise methodically replaces the handset and strides purposefully toward the store's front entrance. As Thelma emerges from the front of the store, her eyes meet Louise's, and they exchange a meaningful look that communicates a shared understanding of their predicament. Thelma takes measured steps around the side of the building, heading purposefully toward the phone, while Louise enters the store searching for a chocolate Yoohoo. Meanwhile, Darryl is visibly upset yet remains glued to the television, engrossed in the game. Thelma struggles to maintain her composure, fighting back tears in an effort to appear strong. They maintain an unspoken silence symbolizing the tension, and Thelma decisively ends the call, disconnecting with a click. Tears begin to stream down Thelma's face as she lowers her gaze, locking onto the ground as she storms back to the car, her emotions in turmoil. In a moment of distraction, she collides with an unexpected passerby, emitting a loud grunt from the impact, which jostles both of them back a few steps. During the brief encounter, she notices the striking blue of his eyes, igniting a desire for him to accompany her. He begins to move away from the car just as Louise exits the store, catching sight of Thelma engaged in conversation with the stranger. Louise momentarily freezes, absorbing the scene before her, then continues her trajectory toward the car with an outwardly calm expression, though her thoughts hint at intense irritation toward Thelma. The hitchhiker gives a nod and starts walking toward the road, appearing quite amiable, much to Thelma's chagrin. She is frustrated at Louise's refusal to offer him a ride but refrains from confronting her about the decision. Louise, maintaining composure, lowers the convertible top and skillfully maneuvers the car out of the parking spot. As they drive away, they observe him walking along the roadside, and he glances back, offering a friendly smile and wave, which they acknowledge while proceeding down the road. A close-up captures the hitchhiker as his smile gradually fades, a fleeting moment of disappointment etched across his face. Inside the car, Thelma adopts a sullen demeanor while, elsewhere, Hal meticulously reviews a list of every registered green T-Bird in the state, scanning the names until LOUISE ELIZABETH SAWYER scrolls into view. Beyond the town's limits, Thelma persistently revisits the hitchhiker topic, unable to let go, while Louise remains visibly rattled, her focus on the road unwavering. Her grip on the steering wheel is so tight it turns her knuckles white, betraying her inner tension. Without warning, she reaches over and locks her door, a gesture of instinctual caution. Meanwhile, an extreme close-up captures Darryl's facial expression, juxtaposed with J.D.'s vigilant gaze down the distant road. Louise, ever watchful, notices a highway patrol car approaching from the opposite direction and continues driving smoothly, allowing the police vehicle to pass by unnoticed, their journey undetected.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Louise slams the closet door, startling Thelma. After a brief silence, Thelma ends the phone call as Louise heads to the front of the store. Thelma exits the store, and they exchange a glance that acknowledges the situation. While Louise goes inside for a chocolate Yoohoo, Thelma walks to a phone, struggling to hold back tears and maintain composure. She ends her call with Darryl abruptly, tears streaming as she returns to the car. In her distress, she collides with a man, noticing his striking blue eyes and wanting him to join them. As he starts to walk away, Louise steps out of the store, momentarily pausing at the sight of Thelma with the man before continuing to the car, expressionless but possibly upset. The Hitchhiker nods and walks towards the road, and although Thelma is frustrated with Louise for not offering him a ride, she lets it go. Louise lowers the car's top, backs out of the parking lot, and they drive away, passing the Hitchhiker who waves as they leave. Thelma sulks while they travel, and elsewhere, Hal reviews a list of registered green T-Birds, with Louise's name appearing. As they drive out of town, Thelma persists in her frustration while Louise remains tense, gripping the steering wheel tightly. She suddenly locks her door as a highway patrol car approaches but passes without noticing them.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Louise slams the closet door, a wooden barrier that has borne witness to many of their hurried packings, causing Thelma to jump. They are silent for a moment with Thelma staring down the road, which leads to their much-needed escape. She puts her finger down on the receiver, the lifeline to their outside world, as Louise hangs up the phone and walks away towards the front of the store, an old general store with a creaky screen door. Thelma comes out of the front of the store, and Thelma and Louise look at each other while this sinks in, the weight of their decision growing heavier. Thelma walks around to the side of the building to the phone as Louise goes into the store for a chocolate Yoohoo, a nostalgic choice for a moment of comfort. Darryl, Thelma's often dismissive husband, is mad, but he's still watching the game, typical of his neglectful attitude. Thelma is trying not to cry and she's trying to be strong. Neither one of them say anything for a moment, and she hangs up on him, the call echoing an unresolved tension. Thelma has tears running down her face and she is watching the ground as she storms back to the car, their getaway vehicle waiting for the next leg of their uncertain journey. She makes a loud grunt as she slams into someone that she did not see, and both people are knocked back a few steps from the force of the collision. She notices how blue his eyes are, a striking feature in the midday sun, and now she wants him to come, an impulsive wish for a new adventure. He starts to walk away from the car. Just then Louise comes out of the store and sees Thelma talking to this guy, and for one moment stops dead in her tracks as she takes this in, then continues toward the car. Although her face is basically expressionless, it’s possible she might kill Thelma with her furious stare. The Hitchhiker, a wanderer accustomed to brief encounters, just nods and starts walking towards the road. The guy does seem really nice, a glimmer of kindness in his smile, and Thelma is really frustrated that Louise wouldn't give him a ride but decides not to confront her. Louise lowers the top of their convertible, an aging blue Thunderbird, and backs the car out. They watch him walk away as Louise pulls out of the parking lot onto the road. They pass the Hitchhiker, who smiles and waves, and they drive down the road. There is a tight shot of the Hitchhiker as the smile fades from his face, a moment of missed opportunity. Thelma looks sulky while Hal, an investigator on their trail, goes over a list of every registered green T-Bird in the state, with names scrolling by as Hal stares blankly at the screen and the name LOUISE ELIZABETH SAWYER scrolls past, a key piece in solving the puzzle of their whereabouts. They are clear of the town, and Thelma is like a dog with a bone, just won't let it drop, while Louise looks very shaken up, emotions churning beneath her calm exterior. She keeps her eyes on the road but she's holding the steering wheel so tightly, her knuckles are white. Suddenly, she reaches over and locks her door, a subtle act of self-preservation. There is an extreme closeup of Darryl's face, his expression of annoyed disinterest clear, and J.D., a charming drifter they previously encountered, is looking down the road, way off in the distance, possibly contemplating his next move. Louise looks down the road and sees a highway patrol car coming towards them, a potential threat to their freedom, and she glides along as the cop car passes on the other side without seeing them, a temporary reprieve in their flight.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Louise taps the closet door, causing Thelma to chuckle. They are silent for a moment with Thelma peering up the road. Thelma skips out of the front of the store, and Thelma and Louise nod at each other while this sinks in. Thelma twirls around to the side of the building to the phone as Louise skips into the store for a chocolate Yoohoo. Darryl is puzzled, but he's still sketching the game. Thelma is trying not to giggle and she's trying to be strong. Neither one of them shout anything for a moment, and she sings to him. Thelma has tears twinkling down her face and she is admiring the ground as she tiptoes back to the car. She makes a soft hum as she drifts into someone that she did not see, and both people are jostled back a few steps from the force of the collision. She notices how blue his eyes are and now she wants him to vanish. He starts to skip away from the car. Just then Louise saunters out of the store and sees Thelma whispering to this guy, and for one moment skips in her tracks as she takes this in, then continues towards the car. Although her face is basically expressionless, it’s possible she might embrace Thelma. The Hitchhiker just shrugs and starts skipping towards the road. The guy does seem really nice and Thelma is really delighted that Louise wouldn't give him a ride but decides not to flatter her. Louise raises the top and spins the car out. They watch him skip away as Louise spins out of the parking lot onto the road. They pass the Hitchhiker, who yawns and stretches, and they glide down the road. There is a tight shot of the Hitchhiker as the grin fades from his face. She keeps her eyes on the road but she's gripping the steering wheel so lightly, her knuckles are relaxed. Suddenly, she reaches over and taps her door. There is an extreme closeup of Darryl's face and J.D. is humming down the road, way off in the distance. Louise looks down the road and sees a highway patrol car sailing down the road towards them, and she glides along as the cop car passes on the other side without acknowledging them.

Nancy comes out of the back of the restaurant, and Nancy and Gerald look at each other while this registers. Nancy walks around to the side of the barn to the laptop as Gerald goes into the restaurant for a vanilla milkshake. Victor is annoyed, but he's still watching the movie. Nancy is trying not to giggle and she's trying to be brave. Neither one of them say anything for a moment, and she hangs up on it. Nancy has rain droplets running down her cheek and she is watching the sidewalk as she storms back to the bicycle. She makes a loud sigh as she bumps into someone that she did not notice, and both individuals are knocked back a few steps from the force of the collision. She notices how green his sneakers are and now she wants him to leave. He starts to stroll away from the bicycle. Just then Gerald comes out of the restaurant and sees Nancy chatting with this gentleman, and for one moment freezes in his tracks as he takes this in, then continues toward the bicycle. Although his face is basically expressionless, it’s possible he might scold Nancy. The Hiker just nods and starts walking towards the alley. The fellow does seem really polite and Nancy is really annoyed that Gerald wouldn't give him a lift but decides not to question him. Gerald raises the bonnet and reverses the bicycle out. They watch him amble away as Gerald drives out of the parking space onto the alley. They pass the Hiker, who grins and waves, and they pedal down the alley. He keeps his eyes on the alley but he's holding the handlebar so tightly, his knuckles are pale. Suddenly, he reaches over and locks his window. test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Gordon slams the basement door, causing Martha to leap. They are silent for a moment with Martha gazing across the field. She puts her hand down on the book as Gordon closes the laptop and strides away towards the back of the library. Martha emerges from the back of the library, and Martha and Gordon glance at each other while this registers. Martha meanders around to the corner of the building to the book as Gordon heads into the library for a chocolate bar. Gregory is upset, but he's still browsing the internet. Martha is trying not to shout and she's trying to be calm. Neither one of them utter anything for a moment, and she disconnects from him. Martha has tears coursing down her face and she is examining the pavement as she marches back to the bicycle. She emits a loud sigh as she collides with someone that she did not notice, and both individuals are jostled back a few steps from the impact of the encounter. She observes how green his eyes are and now she wants him to leave. He starts to stroll away from the bicycle. Just then Gordon exits the library and sees Martha conversing with this stranger, and for a moment halts in his tracks as he processes this, then resumes toward the bicycle. Although his expression is mostly unreadable, it’s conceivable he might reprimand Martha. The Traveler just waves and begins walking towards the field. The stranger does seem really polite and Martha is really annoyed that Gordon wouldn't offer him a ride but resolves not to oppose him. Gordon raises the window and steers the bicycle out. They watch him amble away as Gordon departs the parking space onto the path. They pass the Traveler, who nods and gestures, and they pedal down the path. There is a close shot of the Traveler as the nod fades from his face. Martha looks pensive while Thomas goes over a list of every registered yellow convertible in the county, with identities scrolling by as Thomas stares emptily at the monitor and the name GORDON ALEXANDER SMITH scrolls past. They are free of the village, and Martha is like a cat with a toy, just won't let it rest, while Gordon looks very unsettled. He keeps his gaze on the path but he's gripping the handlebars so tightly, his knuckles are white. Suddenly, he reaches over and fastens his helmet. There is an extreme closeup of Gregory's face and Sam is gazing across the field, far in the distance. Gordon gazes across the field and sees a fire truck coming down the path towards them, and he coasts along as the truck passes on the opposite side without noticing them.

Thelma is trying not to laugh and she's trying to remain calm. Neither one of them speaks for a moment, and she disconnects from him. Thelma has laughter bubbling out of her mouth and she is watching the sky as she marches back to the bicycle. She notices how green his jacket is and now she wants him to join. He starts to stroll away from the bicycle. Just then Louise emerges from the store and sees Thelma chatting to this guy, and for a moment pauses as she absorbs this, then proceeds toward the bicycle. Although her face is mainly blank, it’s possible she might hug Thelma. The Hitchhiker just shrugs and starts walking towards the path. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Daniel sprays the fishbowl lid, causing Sylvia to laugh. They are noisy for a moment with Sylvia squinting down the river. She places her toe down on the toaster as Daniel dusts off the guitar and dances away towards the back of the tent. Sylvia leaps out of the back of the tent, and Sylvia and Daniel grin at each other while this registers. Sylvia skips around to the top of the elevator to the stereo as Daniel tiptoes into the tent for a marshmallow frappe. Quentin is thrilled, but he's still painting the fence. Sylvia is attempting not to cheer and she's attempting to be lighthearted. Neither one of them sings anything for a moment, and she unplugs on him. Sylvia has giggles streaming down her neck and she is examining the tree as she prances back to the bicycle. She emits a soft giggle as she stumbles into someone that she did not hear, and both creatures are bounced forward a few meters from the energy of the encounter. She acknowledges how green his ears are and now she wishes him to stay. He begins to hop away from the bicycle. Just then Daniel tiptoes out of the tent and notices Sylvia chatting to this creature, and for one moment halts silent in his tracks as he absorbs this, then proceeds toward the bicycle. Although his expression is mostly cheerful, it’s likely he might hug Sylvia. The Juggler just grins and skips hopping towards the hill. The creature does appear quite quirky and Sylvia is extremely relieved that Daniel wouldn't offer him a lift but opts not to scold him. Daniel raises the umbrella and spins the bicycle out. They observe him skip away as Daniel glides out of the meadow onto the hill. They zoom past the Juggler, who winks and claps, and they roll down the hill. There is a wide angle of the Juggler as the grin fades from his ears. Sylvia appears whimsical while Greg flips over a map of every classified red skateboard in the city, with colors passing by as Greg winks playfully at the picture and the shade LIME GREEN CARRIE SMITH passes past. They are free of the meadow, and Sylvia is like a cat with a feather, just won't let it slip, while Daniel appears very thrilled. He keeps his wings on the hill but he's holding the cup so softly, his lips are wet. Unexpectedly, he stretches over and opens his window. There is an extreme panorama of Quentin's ears and Patrick is gazing up the hill, far up in the sky. Daniel gazes up the hill and views a mail truck flying up the hill towards them, and he floats around as the owl truck glides on the opposite side without noticing them.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Louise slams the closet door, startling Thelma, who looks down the road while Louise hangs up the phone and enters the store for a chocolate Yoohoo. Thelma, trying to remain strong, ends a tense call with a mad Darryl and storms back to the car, bumping into a man with blue eyes. Louise notices Thelma talking to the man and momentarily freezes before heading to the car, remaining expressionless. Despite wanting to give the man a ride, Thelma refrains from confronting Louise's refusal. As they leave, the hitchhiker smiles and waves, but the smile fades as they pass. Thelma sulks, and Hal reviews registered green T-Birds, with Louise's name appearing on screen. Louise is visibly tense, holding the steering wheel tightly, and locks her door as they clear the town. A patrol car approaches, but they remain unnoticed as it passes by.

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: Although her face is basically expressionless it is possible she might kill Thelma The Hitchhiker just nods and starts walking towards the road The guy does seem really nice and Thelma is really frustrated that Louise would not give him a ride but decides not to confront her Louise lowers the top and backs the car out They watch him walk away as Louise pulls out of the parking lot onto the road They pass the Hitchhiker who smiles and waves and they drive down the road There is a tight shot of the Hitchhiker as the smile fades from his face Thelma looks sulky while Hal goes over a list of every registered green TBird in the state with names scrolling by as Hal stares blankly at the screen and the name LOUISE ELIZABETH SAWYER scrolls past They are clear of the town and Thelma is like a dog with a bone just will not let it drop while Louise looks very shaken up She keeps her eyes on the road but she is holding the steering wheel so tightly her knuckles are white Suddenly she reaches over and locks her door There is an extreme closeup of Darryl's face and JD is looking down the road way off in the distance Louise looks down the road and sees a highway patrol car coming down the road towards them and she glides along as the cop car passes on the other side without seeing them Louise slams the closet door causing Thelma to jump They are silent for a moment with Thelma staring down the road She puts her finger down on the receiver as Louise hangs up the phone and walks away towards the front of the store Thelma comes out of the front of the store and Thelma and Louise look at each other while this sinks in Thelma walks around to the side of the building to the phone as Louise goes into the store for a chocolate Yoohoo Darryl is mad but he is still watching the game Thelma is trying not to cry and she is trying to be strong Neither one of them say anything for a moment and she hangs up on him Thelma has tears running down her face and she is watching the ground as she storms back to the car She makes a loud grunt as she slams into someone that she did not see and both people are knocked back a few steps from the force of the collision She notices how blue his eyes are and now she wants him to come He starts to walk away from the car Just then Louise comes out of the store and sees Thelma talking to this guy and for one moment stops dead in her tracks as she takes this in then continues toward the car
